course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Laboratory for General Chemistry I
course.description: This course is the laboratory class designed for students who are enrolled in CHEM 1010 or CHEM 1020. With laboratory experience acquired in this course, students will be able to relate the physical and chemical principles and theories in practice, perform basic chemical laboratory techniques, and develop their data analyzing skills. Graded P or F.
course.corequisites: CHEM 1010 OR CHEM 1020

reviews.author: アグネス
reviews.comment_content:
Expt.1: Identification of Polymers
Expt. 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Expt. 3:Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Expt. 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Expt. 5:Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Expt. 6:Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Expt. 7:Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
Expt. 8:Boyle’s Law
Expt. 9:Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
reviews.comment_teaching:
instructor 除左briefing 會講英文, 大部份時間, 見你係香港人既話都用中文, 唔洗驚聽唔明.
TA們都好好人, 會成日提你有咩要注意! 見你迷惘都會過黎幫下你教下你. 完全唔洗怕唔識做.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail course.
40%written assignments (worksheet)
20%lab class performance
40%final examination
worksheet 唔難做, 唔識可以問下TA, 所以基本上都可以滿分.
final 全mc.
reviews.comment_workload:
冇咩workload, 只係要你出席晒class intro, lab 同final.
每星期做一個lab, 其實都唔洗點prelab, briefing聽完佢講就會識做.
worksheets全部in class. 差唔多次次都可以早走.

reviews.author: 郑媛
reviews.title: Good option for lab course
reviews.comment_content:
Easy.
Most knowledge has been learned in high school. But experimental methods are worth learning.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Really clear, and covers every detail.
If you don't understand, no worry, TAs are nice and willing to help you. But actually, it's not usually needed.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy to pass. As long as you finished all the reports carefully and attend the lab, you will pass.
reviews.comment_workload: Just a report after lab, and watching the demonstration before the laboratory is enough. The report doesn't take much time, at most half an hour.

reviews.author: wangkim
reviews.title: great simple course
reviews.comment_content:
5 experiments:
Chemiluminescence

Boyle’s Law

Determination of the Boiling Point of an Unknown Liquid

Determination of Vitamin C Content in Health Drinks by Redox Titration

Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
reviews.comment_teaching: very easy to understand, and conduct, before the lab you will have 2 videos explaining what to do and how to do it, and during the lab instructor briefly describes the content too. During the experiment, TA's are ready to help as well. If you still encounter any problems check out "chemistry: Atoms first approach" Best chem textbook I've ever seen so far
reviews.comment_grading:
pass or fail
for passing:
an average score of 5 lab reports 5 or more out of ten
no more than one lab report below 4
in the beginning, there are 2 MC quizzes with unlimited attempts
reviews.comment_workload:
not heavy at all, every 2 weeks one lab class, and one lab report, it should not take more than 2 hours for lab reports if you listened carefully and knew what you're doing in class, from important notes:
- lab coat and glasses are compulsory, they will not allow you in without them
- before every lab class, you have to print out the lab manual which is also sometimes quite problematic
- in case you couldn't attend the lab, don't panic, just write to a TA explaining the reason for your absence, and they will arrange a make-up session for you


conclusion: very nice and interesting course with friendly TAs and instructor, not hard to pass at all, and they will even host a zoom section for those who don't know how to use google sheets/excel

reviews.author: Blue science
reviews.comment_content:
As the course is only graded on P/F, you can very much enjoy the experiment if you like doing experiments, and you don't need to worry too much even if you hate doing experiments.

The experiments are:
1: Chemiluminescence
2: Boyle’s Law
3: Determination of Boiling Point of an Unknown Liquid
4: Determination of Vitamin C Content in Health Drinks by Redox Titration
5: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor provides a very detailed explanation of all of the requirements and experiments we have to do. He can guide you through the concepts of the experiments which may make you feel more interested in doing experiments.

When doing experiments, if you get lost and cannot figure it out from the lab manual, you can always ask the instructor or staff or TAs to help.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's only P or F.
It is very easy to pass the course.

In order to pass the course, you only need to do the following:
- Get 80% or higher in the Safety Test and the Laboratory Apparatus Test. (with unlimited attempts)
- Attend all experiment classes and obtain reasonable experimental results (only 5 classes)
- Submit all the lab reports (also only 5 of them)
- Get an average result of at least 5 points for the lab reports
- Do not get more than 1 lab report scored below 4 points
reviews.comment_workload:
You basically only need to do the 5 lab reports, which shall be submitted twice a week. Therefore, the workload can be considered very light in my opinion.

The lab reports are also not that difficult as there are videos to teach you how to finish them, and they can be finished in a short time (less than 1 hour).

reviews.author: BJ Wong
reviews.title: Easy to pass
reviews.comment_content:
5 experiments in this course in total.
Attend all the experiments in order to get a pass.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor will do a short briefing before each experiment.
All the experiments procedures can be obtained in the lab manual.
The TAs are nice. 唔識做可以揾佢地幫手
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail.
做曬所有experiments, 認真做d lab report基本上就可以pass
reviews.comment_workload:
One lab report after every experiments (i.e. 5 lab reports in total)
The lab reports are easy. 基本上最多15分鐘就做完一份

reviews.author: crazyyau
reviews.comment_content:
Experiments:
1. Chemiluminescence
2. Boyle's Law
3. Determination of Boiling Point of an Unknown Liquid
4. Determination of Vitamin C Content in Health Drinks by Redox Titration
5. Hess's Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
reviews.comment_teaching: The lab menus were clear, and there were some videos for students to pre-lab. Every time before the experiments, the details would be discussed.
reviews.comment_grading: Just pass or fail. If you put some time on the lab reports, having a pass is not something hard.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one lab report after each experiment. Light workload. But remember to attend all sessions.

reviews.author: Milktea
reviews.title: You can pass if you did everything on time
reviews.comment_content:
Course Schedule:

Pre-lab:  Both must be over 80%
Laboratory safety
Common laboratory apparatus

Experiments:
1. Chemiluminescence
2. Boyle's Law
3. Determination of Boiling Point of an Unknown Liquid
4. Determination of Vitamin C Content in Health Drinks by Redox Titration
5. Hess's Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base

You will only fail if you get an average mark lower or equal to 5 or get two lab reports with marks lower than 4

The lab reports are not that complicated, so basically it's an easy pass
reviews.comment_teaching:
Meh, it's basically self-study, watch the instruction video twice and you will understand what's going on, the experiments are similar to those in middle school

if you don't know what's going on, just ask your labmates or the TA for help
reviews.comment_grading:
It's just pass or fail
just do the lab reports on time to prevent a mark deduction and you will pass this course
reviews.comment_workload:
Some lab reports are longer than others but it's manageable, if you are scared that your answers are wrong, just ask your friends if they have the same answer as you

You will just need to do lab once every two weeks and you can leave early if you finished earlier than others, which is great

reviews.author: SATB
reviews.comment_content:
Five experiments in total.
1. Chemiluminescence
2. Boyle's Law
3. Determination of Boiling Point of an Unknown Liquid
4. Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
5. Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
reviews.comment_teaching:
ONLINE SEMESTER

Not much teaching, basically self-learning.

Each weak there will be a tutorial session by a TA, he/she will explain some key points in the experiment, then there will be Q&A sessions but I never attended
reviews.comment_grading:
Graded P or F

To get a P, you must:
Get 80% or above for the safety test and lab apparatus test,
Get an average of 50% or above for lab quizzes,
Submit ALL lab reports,  
Get an average of 50% or above for lab reports,
And have no report scored less than 40%

These should not be difficult to fulfill.
reviews.comment_workload:
At the beginning of the semester, there will be a safety test and lab apparatus test, 15 MCQs each.

Throughout the semester, there will be 5 lab quizzes and lab reports. You must complete these after watching 2 videos for each experiment (one about theory and one about experimental procedures)

The lab reports only have some fill-in-the-blanks, short questions, and simple calculations which can be completed within 30 minutes.

No hands-on experiences, probably just because of the pandemic, I think starting from 2021 Fall, there will be face-to-face lab sessions, so you can actually do the experiments yourself.

reviews.author: stress+tension
reviews.title: Meh. Pass fail course. Nobody cares.
reviews.comment_content:
Meh.

The experiments themselves shouldve been interesting (had the class not been taught online), but we only ever got to see TAs perform the experiments by watching a bloody video. Boring.

The experiments had almost nothing to do with chem1020. Learned almost nothing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One word - boring.

Due to the pandemic, this lab course was not carried out on campus.  Instead, 10-minute lab videos were prepared so that we could watch TAs do the experiment (sounds exciting, right?). However, the videos were boring, slow and featured an instructor with the heaviest cantonese accent i have ever heard.

Given the pandemic, I understand the measures that had to be taken to ensure the safety of students and staff, but the instructor couldve put more effort into making the lab videos engaging (and useful).

A biweekly lab report based on the videos needed to be submitted. However, they were just mechanical copying and pasting of data onto spreadsheets (again, exciting, right?). Not much of my brain was used. Did learn how to use a bit of excel tho, so i guess thats good?
reviews.comment_grading:
Again, pass fail. Nobody cares.

It doesnt matter if you get a 6/10 or a 10/10. It makes no difference.

Also its very easy to pass as long as you submit the lab reports (which are quite easy actually.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.

A lab report (which roughly takes 0.5-1 hours each) for each experiment. There was a new 'experiment' (if you could call them experiments) every fortnight. So 0.5-1 hrs every two weeks, actually quite a nice and light workload considering this is hkust.

Considering this is a 1-cred course, the workload is actually reaonsable.

reviews.author: Polly0929
reviews.title: BORING BUT EASY TO PASS (ONLINE)
reviews.comment_content:
1. chemiluminescence
2. Boyle's law
3. determination of boiling point of an unknown liquid
4. determination of iron content by redox titration
5. hess's law
just like phy and chem in DSE
reviews.comment_teaching:
boring but easy to understand
(online)

need to watch 2 video

optional zoom Q&A sessions will be provided for us to ask questions about the experiments.
reviews.comment_grading:
very easy to pass
5 lab quizzes: average more than 50%
lab report: average more than 50% and no more than one lab report scored below 4 points

my marks Quiz 34344/5
             report 9.5 10 10 9.25 10/10
reviews.comment_workload:
1 lab + 1 quiz twice a week
very low

no attendance

reviews.author: Knight
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a general chemistry laboratory course, which requires you to carry out some simple chemical experiments with the application of some chemical concepts and knowledge.

Experiment 1: Chemiluminescence
Experiment 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of Volatile Liquids
Experiment 8: Boyle’s Law
Experiment 9: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor will introduce the experiment briefly at the beginning of each session, and you can just follow the procedures as shown in the PPTs to complete the experiment.

All the professors and TAs are really kind and helpful. They will definitely help you if you have any questions about the experiment or you don't understand the steps. Sometimes the TAs will come to you and tell you how to do the experiment in a better way even if you don't have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is only pass or fail, so if you attend enough sessions (8 out of 9) and complete all the tasks appropriately in all sessions, you will definitely get a pass in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is very light. You are only required to hand in the completed task in each experiment session after you complete the experiment by yourself, and those tasks are not really difficult if you have studied chemistry in high schools before. Even if you don't know how to answer the questions in the tasks, TAs will definitely explain the details to you and help you to understand the tasks.

reviews.author: 平凡小路人
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment on some basic chemistry concept.
In my opinion, the learning amount is just right and I do think I even learn more in lab than sitting in lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor and all TAs are all really really nice!
Just ask them for help when you have no idea what you are doing. They are super nice.
The instructor would have a briefing section before they let you start with your experiment, and many answers you need for your lab report are mentioned in the section, so do pay attention.
And since they always talk in Cantonese, this is a bit unfair to non-canton speaker. But for canton speaker, it becomes less scary if we want to ask for help.
(And when they are bored, they even casually chat and help you with your experiment)
reviews.comment_grading:
Just try your best with the experiment and write the experiment data properly into the lab report.
Pre-read the lab material before labs so you know what information do you need. Pay attention in briefing and you should get what you need and you are ready to pass.
reviews.comment_workload:
This does need some work, but not much and reasonable.
Pre-read lab material, pay attention in briefing section, do the experiment properly. Thats it, these are all you need.

reviews.author: Dcture
reviews.title: I wish they could speak LESS CANTONESE
reviews.comment_content: We performed simple and fundamental experiments and the main purpose of this course is to teach us the basic principles of laboratory chemistry.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. HUANG introduces the mechanism of each experiment at the beginning of each class and approximately takes 15 minutes. I don't get it why the professor always speaks Cantonese first and "repeat" it in English. As such repetition takes much time and not everyone understands Cantonese, the introductions were not efficient and always too fast.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance is the most important factor in grading so just make sure you don't miss too much courses.
reviews.comment_workload: we need to preview the lab report and get familiar with the procedures.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Better Than Nothing
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Density of an Egg
Experiment 2: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 5: Boyle’s Law

Experiment 6: Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
Experiment 7: Kinetic Studies of Chemical Reaction
Experiment 8: Le Châtelier’s Principle
Experiment 9: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Yip was quite nice and presentable, but his TAs were not, especially the one who had a “Mediterranean” on the top of his head.

Students called this TA “Lung Gor (Brother Dragon)”. This man was astonishingly rude to students, and liked to frame students of “breaking” apparatus to extort compensation.

I don't know whether “Lung Gor” is still working at UST. It has been two and a half years ago since this course ended for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab report：40%
Lab class performance：20%
Final Exam：40%

Attendance for ALL experiments is REQUIRED.

Every student is designated a locker outside the lab. You cannot randomly use one of them. You MUST BRING your own LOCK for using your locker every time, and the lock MUST have your name and Student No. WRITTEN on it, or MARKS would be DEDUCTED without warning.

Such ridiculous rules are strictly enforced.

Recite “sources” carefully in answering questions.
A classmate of my session was caught copying answers from “sources” to the blank area of his Lab Manual during one of the experiments. I didn't know who he was and how he ended up that time.

The Final Exam was ALL MC questions. They were so hard that I almost guessed for every question.

Luckily, I was given a B－.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab Reports that resemble regular high school assignments. Take data, plot graph, calculations, complete questions that limit answers to 15 words each.  

Lab Reports MUST be HANDED in BEFORE you LEAVE the lab, or ZERO would be given.

reviews.author: chloew
reviews.title: It's okay
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Identification of Polymers
Experiment 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
Experiment 8: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
Experiment 9: Boyle’s Law

Basically most of them you have done it in high school and are really easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be honest very little teaching is required but I think the contents are explained well enough.
TAs/IAs are friendly and nice. They really want to go home as soon as possible though, a little impatient. But just ask them any questions when you encounter problem, they are very helpful and are really good at helping with any problems you might have.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's a pass/fail course so you just need to attend to every class, get a passing score in every experiments (which is very easy to do) and pass the final, again which is easy to do.

You will most likely to have a quiz in the very first lesson about safety guidelines, which will be after a thorough explanation of the safety guidelines, you will have to pass that to but's just for your safety.
reviews.comment_workload: There are no assignments. You just need to read the lab manuals before each lab session.

reviews.author: Hamburger Milk
reviews.title: AN EASY TO PASS COURSE
reviews.comment_content:
I think the content is just so-so. Some of the experiments are interesting.

Experiment 1: Identification of Polymers
Experiment 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
Experiment 8: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
Experiment 9: Boyle’s Law
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor has a little accent, but I think his explanation is ok.

I think all of TA(teaching assistant), IA(instructor assistant),etc. are very kind. But you may find some of them not so "friendly" at first. Take it easy! Ask them whenever you are confused.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it's very easy to pass if you are able to attend every experiment (even you may be late for some sessions), attend the final exam, prepare for the exam for 1 hour.
reviews.comment_workload: Maybe this course only need to read the material before the experiment every time and prepare for the final exam for an hour.

reviews.author: iwantarange
reviews.title: Quite boring, but not much workload
reviews.comment_content:
As this is a general chemistry lab, do not expect the experiments are interesting. To be precise, some of them may have appeared in high school, which does not make the content of this lab good. Do not expect to learn much from this lab.
Moreover, you may see some 'interesting' lab set-up such as using measuring cylinder when preparing solutions to do certain titration. This is not too reasonable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is alright, not much special. Instructors do not have very good pronunciation. Nevertheless, some IAs and TAs are quite helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Just pass or fail, so nothing special if you are an ordinary student. The instructors may not be willing to fail a lot of students, so follow all instructions should be enough. However, the final exam covers all labs performed during the lab sessions, and the questions are quite deep into the experiments. Try to get a thorough understanding on the rationale behind each experiment rather than doing meaningless recital of lab manuals and reports.
reviews.comment_workload: All lab reports must be handed in during lab sessions, so no workload other than lab sessions. Much better than physics lab which I heard others mentioned that pre-lab questions are required.

reviews.author: nora
reviews.comment_content:
Basic secondary experiments that are quite easy to do
Attendance require
reviews.comment_teaching: Around 30 minutes introduction in the beginning before start the experiment. During your work, you can ask TA for help. They are nice and kind and are willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading: As it is just a pass fail course so there will be no grading. However, there is still a 1 hour final about the experiment you have done through out the whole semester. Just read through the whole lab menu and it is fine.
reviews.comment_workload: You only have to print the lab menu every time before you arrive the laboratory. You don't have to read it or do any preparation. Also you need to complete the whole lab menu before you leave the lab. Therefore there is no extra task for you to do outside the lecture time.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Identification of Polymers
Experiment 2:Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess's Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of Volatile Liquids
Experiment 8: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job's Method
Experiment 9: Boyle's Law
reviews.comment_teaching:
5-15 mins briefing before doing experiments. Teaching was quite clear.
However, sometimes the powerpoint does not match with the lab manual.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail grading.
40% written assignments
20% lab class performance
40% final exam
You have to pass all of the above parts to pass the course.

Final Exam:
1hr 30 MC+1 short question with several parts
Each experiments will be asked in several MCs
reviews.comment_workload:
Look lab manual once before doing experiments is better.
No need to prepare final exam much hard but don't go without preparation.

reviews.author: Andy HK
reviews.comment_content: contain some secondary school experiment like titration.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very kind and nice so we won't feel stressful and he would remind us the main point before each experiment. The teaching assistant Joanne is extremely helpful. I am afraid of doing experiment and i am very scared.  I am always the last student to finish the experiment. Joanne always helps me to do and teach me how to do the worksheet.
reviews.comment_grading: It is easy to get a pass if you attend all the classes and submit all the worksheet.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is slightly heavy because we have nine experiments in total and one experiment per week. Each experiment takes 2 to 2.5 hours to complete and after each experiment, we need to submit a worksheet in which some of the questions are challenging.

reviews.author: C.ko
reviews.comment_content:
In the first lab section, he will explain the safety precaution and briefly introduce the outline of the course.
Experiment 1: Identification of Polymers
Experiment 2: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
Experiment 5: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 6: Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
Experiment 7: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 8: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
Experiment 9: Boyle’s Law
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof simply reads from the power point. Some teaching assistants will answer students' questions in a friendly tone.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair
reviews.comment_workload: There is one lab session every week and a lab report that have to handed in at the end of lessons.

reviews.author: Alpha703
reviews.comment_content:
10 lab sessions. The first is to introduce the course, talk about safety precautions, some lab equipments and procedures. The next 9 sessions and experiments.
Experiment 1: Identification of Polymers
Experiment 2: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
Experiment 5: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 6: Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
Experiment 7: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 8: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
Experiment 9: Boyle’s Law
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Yip is responsible for the briefing before each experiment. Mostly read out from ppt, with some demonstration/videos on some important procedures in the experiment.
The attitude of IAs/TAs are at least ok to me. Some are more friendly, but some will respond to student's questions with a cold tone. They are usually willing to demonstrate some difficult lab procedures(such as pouring liquid to a burette) or remind students how should they dispose of the chemical wastes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Graded Pass or Fail. Not sure about the grading scheme or the pass/fail threshold.
Me: Attend 9 regular sessions, 1 make-up session(forgot to wear trousers), getting 70-90% in all lab reports -->Pass
Failing in the attendance part will lead to a fail, details as follows:
-Must attend all lab sessions
-Go to make-up lab sessions(choose one from LA1-LA6 regular sessions) in case of the following reasons: Sick/Special reasons(With supporting documents), forget to wear trousers/jeans, wearing inappropriate shoes, late for >15 minutes
-Missing one lab+its make-up lab(if applicable)-->Fail(course incomplete)
-Must wear trousers/jeans and shoes that don't expose your foot(i.e. no sandals etc.)
-Must wear lab coat and safety goggles(You can borrow them in the lab, but due to hygiene issues better to bring your own, can buy from science student societies)
reviews.comment_workload:
Attendance:(See 'grading' part)
Lab: You will need 1-2 hours to finish the lab and the lab report, then you can leave early. The lab work are not very demanding. Only recording data and simple calculations are required in lab report. No formal pre-lab required(Of course you should go through the lab manual). Make sure to print out the lab report from the lab manual by yourself and bring it to the lab. Make sure to 'check-out' before handing in your lab report each time or else you will not receive any marks.
Final exam: 50 MCs. Revising the lab manual is compulsory(so that you can understand the questions), but far from enough to get the correct answer. Maybe you can buy the non-compulsory reference book of this course or look for some sources(if any) to get a better result. After all, if you perform at least moderately you should be able to pass...

reviews.author: Teresa
reviews.comment_content: Similar to secondary school chem, is just a course you how to use the experiment apparatus. An easy course, what you need to do is just follow the lab manual to do the experiment
reviews.comment_teaching: mainly do experiments and the instructor will remind the key procedures of the experiments. Some TA are not very nice.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade course. Mean score will be B.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload. One experiment each week. Only need to look for procedures before lessons in order to have a better understanding of the experiment and do it faster. You can leave early when you finish the experiments.

reviews.author: Sherman
reviews.title: A good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
There are total 9 labs and 1 briefing session on lab safety.

Experiment 1: Density of an Egg
Experiment 2: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 5: Boyle’s Law
Experiment 6: Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
Experiment 7: Kinetic Studies of Chemical Reaction
Experiment 8: Le Châtelier’s Principle
Experiment 9: Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid

Most of the experiments are boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: All the Dr Yip's teaching could be found in the lab manual. But the exam contains out-syl scientific thinking questions more than the in-content questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Great. Moderate performance in lab reports and final exam, but I got a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: About 2 hours for each lab. It also have an hour final exam for all MC questions. Quite heavy workload for 1-credit course.

reviews.author: andyasdfadfhadt
reviews.comment_content: 中學有讀過chem同phy既話會覺得d野好簡單 點解大學都仲做 當係學下d儀器點用
reviews.comment_teaching: 無咩教既成份 不過有野唔識做你好聲好氣問TA都會答你
reviews.comment_grading:
之前d lab report個個抄sources 搞到佢人人lab report分差唔多 唯有將d以前接受既答案都當錯
第二個後果係Final exam難到pk 又問埋d唔知點會expect我地識既out c 野 但係先影響grade最多
reviews.comment_workload:
load唔大 但係lab唔可以遲多過5分鐘到＋最多因事 因病make up一次 同埋TA好鐘意扣你分 比較大壓力
final 唔洗點溫 溫左都係唔會識

reviews.author: peachyy
reviews.comment_content:
Some basic concepts of physics and chemistry are included in the experiment.  The experiments are not too difficult to be done and follow the instructions should be fine.  You need to submit a lab report in class after each experiment.

Major topics include:
1. Density of an Egg
2. Paper Chromatography
3. Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
4. Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
5. Boyle’s Law
6. Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
7. Kinetic Studies of Chemical Reaction
8. Le Châtelier’s Principle
9. Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
reviews.comment_teaching: A 10-15 minute briefing session will be held before starting to do the experiment.  Then you need to do the experiment individually and submit the lab report.  You can ask the TAs if you have any questions about the experiment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Although the grading on lab report and class performance is harsh and you may easily lose marks by simply having a minor mistake, the grading in overall is fine and it mainly depends on final exam.  
The final exam consists of only multiple-choice questions.  It includes some concepts and extra knowledge behind the experiments and I think some questions are quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
No extra workload after class as the lab report is handed in during the class.
If you want to get higher marks, I suggest you to look at the lab manual before doing the experiment and prepare for the answers of the lab report questions.

reviews.author: USTian
reviews.comment_content:
I don't think the course really complemented General Chemistry I, but the concepts behind the experiments weren't too difficult. Following the lab manual instructions will yield proper results.

1. Density of an Egg
2. Paper Chromatography
3. Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
4. Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization between Strong Acid and Strong Base
5. Boyle’s Law
6. Determination of Boiling Point of Unknown Liquid
7. Kinetic Studies of Chemical Reaction
8. Le Châtelier’s Principle
9. Molar Mass of a Volatile Liquid
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor would give a 10, 15-minute briefing about the experiments each time, but I was placed in a bad position that I could not see him. He sometimes gives necessary information for the experiment, but mostly you can just find it in the lab manual. Do ask the TAs if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab report - 40%
Lab class performance - 20%
Final Exam - 40%

Lab reports are graded harshly -- one mistake loses you a mark, and each report is out of 10 marks. Draw graphs carefully, and follow instructions as indicated on the reports. I also got marks deducted because I wrote like 25 words for a question that instructed me to write less than 20 words.
Final exam seemed to include some extra knowledge and applications of concepts with different chemicals, etc. But I still managed to receive a final grade of A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Lab reports are done in-class, and you have more than enough time to finish the experiments and the reports. I would recommend reading through the lab manuals before going to class, and searching up anything you don't understand, equations and other information needed to answer the questions for the lab report.

reviews.author: 濤
reviews.comment_content: 中學有讀過chem同phys就好輕鬆，主要都係中學ge content，D lab都容易做ge，唔會太複雜。
reviews.comment_teaching: 都ok ge因為lab唔會太難做，所以唔會有咩太講唔清楚ge問題。
reviews.comment_grading: 都幾好grade，因為都係中學ge content，final都唔會好難，不過final要60分鐘60題MC就有少少辛苦。
reviews.comment_workload: 1cred course真心無咩workload，做lab前15-30分鐘前睇下就Ok ga la

reviews.author: SnaKe
reviews.title: Grade不錯
reviews.comment_content: 每堂的實驗都唔同,內容都係關於physical chem,neutralization,chemical equilibrium,general gas law 等等,做完即堂交份lab report
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂一開波係教你點做個實驗,之後就到自己做。有d TA幾好人,都幾解答到問題(包括report的答案)
reviews.comment_grading:
認真唔錯,dse有讀過phy chem基本上冇問題
lab report overall攞8/10。final全mc,比60分鐘你做60條mc。唔知攞咩分,不過我就有1/3的答案唔肯定,最後A+
reviews.comment_workload:
唔大啦,1credit姐
想攞高d分就上堂前睇睇experiment procedure同埋搵搵d lab report question嘅ans

reviews.author: spamming
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Chemiluminescence
Experiment 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of Volatile Liquids
Experiment 8: Boyle’s Law
Experiment 9: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
reviews.comment_teaching: 內容一般，實驗前有個簡介，TA會輪換，大多是local，會講粵語很方便，不懂就問，TA就會解答。Prof 人很好
reviews.comment_grading:
pass 或 fail
參加8節以上就可以達到要求，達不了有補充的實驗可以補做，report全交就好
reviews.comment_workload: 沒有課後作業，可以編實驗數據，做得快可以提前一個多小時就走，一個半小時就可以結束

reviews.author: CelinaC
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Chemiluminescence
Experiment 2: Forensic Examination of Pen Inks: Paper Chromatography
Experiment 3: Emission Spectrum of Atomic Hydrogen
Experiment 4: Determination of Iron Content by Redox Titration
Experiment 5: Determination of Boiling Point of An Unknown Liquid
Experiment 6: Hess’s Law: Calculation of Heat of Neutralization of Strong Acid and Strong Base
Experiment 7: Molar Mass of Volatile Liquids
Experiment 8: Boyle’s Law
Experiment 9: Determination of the Empirical Formula by Job’s Method
如你所見，其實唔少係中學做過幾實驗，所以容易handle。
reviews.comment_teaching: 一開始會先清楚講明做實驗既流程，只要仔細聽就知點做。而且中途會有tutor睇住，一做錯d咩基本上都會即時矯正，雖然唔知對分數有冇影響，但做出黎既實驗唔會錯得太離譜。
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail
有3個aspect，要三個都pass先會pass
但其實attend其中8個，交齊lab report一般都pass
記得要自己先print好lab report，如果唔係可能扣分
同埋唔好遲到，簡介有大概20min，簡介過左一半都未到好似有幾大影響。
reviews.comment_workload: 全部report都係堂上交，一般都係得兩三版，有唔少只需fill in the blank，而且問題唔難答，實在唔識可以請教helper，真係好輕鬆。

reviews.author: legendarychriz
reviews.title: Fun course
reviews.comment_content:
A course which attracts students who do not wish to take 4 credit course if they have registered CHEM 1020.
Apply what you have learned in high school in labs.
Reminds you the good old days in laboratories, and gain experience of performing experiments in a university.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor goes through what we should do in the lab for 15 mins, and he will leave the duty to his lab technicians.

You can grab a chance to know more friends in this course, such as the one who sits next to you. Lab technicians are glad to answer the questions, if you meet the right one. I once met a pretty girl in this course, but this chance does not belong to me...

REMEMBER TO TELL THE LAB TECHNICIANS THAT YOU HAVE FINISHED THE LAB AND ASK THEM TO CHECK OUT!!!

If you didn't do so, your marks on lab report ( the 40% one) will be deducted.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% score can be seen on canvas ( lab technique )
40% for scores of your lab report
40% for final exam

people generally have good lab techniques, the mean seen on canvas is usually about 8-9, sometimes even 9.3.

Once I got 4/10 in lab technique because a mainland technician is in the lab, the others are all locals supervising our lab, and they generally give me better grades.

Don't be late, otherwise risk mark penalties.
If you request a make-up lab because you are late, you will get 50% for that lab, which will affect your grade eventually.

Will update this after my finals.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 credit course and you talk to me about workload?
Well there's workload, but its way too light than other courses, just go through the lab menu and you will handle the experiment like an expert.
